page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY
page.content: The 12km. square is predominantly rural in character, with the land being used for the growing of barley, oats or grass for silage or rough grazing for cattle and sheep. There are only two residential areas in it, namely, the private housing estates{LOCHARDIL}and{HOLM,} but they are extending and some of the farmland will disappear over the next few years as other housing estates take over. To the west, the{RIVER NESS}and{ the{CALEDONIAN CANAL}run through the area with a few beautiful houses bordering them. To the south and east the ground rises fairly swiftly and is dotted by many different types of farms. It is an area which is now undergoing changes which will, in the next 10 years change its character.
